title: U.S. Releases 9/11 Commission Interview With George W. Bush, Dick Cheney
description: The April 2004 Oval Office interview includes discussion of intelligence warnings, and the former president’s recollections of his actions during the attacks

title: Russia, Iran Pledge to Deepen Ties Amid Ukraine War
description: The relationship between Moscow and Tehran is evolving toward an ideologically rooted anti-Western alliance

title: U.S. Plan to Ramp Up Carbon Credits Faces Doubts at COP27
description: Climate envoy John Kerry outlined a carbon-credit plan that aims to pump billions of dollars into developing countries’ energy transition, while some businesses expressed caution over investing in the program.

title: Israel Strikes Suspected Iran Weapons Convoy in Syria
description: The attack late Tuesday destroyed several vehicles and killed at least 10 people, say people familiar with the attack.

title: Europe Doubles Down on Big Government
description: Faced with soaring inflation and an energy crisis, European politicians are adding thousands of public-sector jobs, guaranteeing business loans, subsidizing energy bills and splurging on infrastructure.

title: Bangladesh, IMF Agree on $4.5 Billion Aid Package
description: High inflation, a plunging local currency and recession concerns in export markets have placed the Bangladesh economy under pressure.

title: Under Xi Jinping, Women in China Have Given Up Gains
description: Women’s labor-force participation has fallen since Xi took power in 2012, and China has dropped 33 places in a global gender-gap report.

title: Brittney Griner Is Moved to Russian Penal Colony
description: The U.S. basketball star was transferred to a penal colony in Russia to serve the remainder of a nine-year drugs conviction, dashing supporters’ hopes that she might be freed in a prisoner swap before having to do hard time.

title: Ukrainian Forces Move Into Key Town North of Kherson
description: Ukraine’s troops pushed into the town Snihurivka as they advanced their efforts to retake territory in the south of the country, while intense fighting rages in the eastern Donetsk region.

title: China Resists Climate Pressure From West, but Makes Gains on Its Own
description: Beijing is unlikely to bow to pressure to cut emissions, though it may end up slowing their growth significantly.

title: China Producer Prices Turn Negative in Warning Sign for Global Economy
description: Consumer-price inflation also slowed to a five-month low, a reflection of the economic toll from Covid restrictions and a real-estate slide.

title: U.S. Allies Seek to Stop Former Military Pilots From Helping China
description: Australia will review policies after an investigation into the training of Chinese aircrews raises concerns.
